SENT.plain: A number of studies have demonstrated that certain immunocompetent cells play a role in the regulation of normal erythropoiesis

These regulatory cells (monocytes--macrophages, lymphocytes) modulate almost every phase of the erythropoietic process, and along with erythropoietin represent the major controlling force in erythropoiesis

Evidence indicate that pathological alterations of these cell-mediated activities can lead to clinical disturbances of red cell production such as is seen in patients with Diamond-Blackfan syndrome and aplastic anemia
